channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Barangays to help ensure physical distancing in classrooms
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Education will tap local government units, especially barangays to ensure that students will observe physical distancing measures if limited face-to-face classes will be allowed in areas with no cases of coronavirus disease 2019, a DepEd official said yesterday.

item.title: Small fuel price cuts set this week
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Minimal price cuts on gasoline products are seen this week with Unioil Philippines warning motorists to expect mixed adjustments.

item.title: ‘LGUs should pass uniform ordinances for quarantine violators’
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Interior Secretary Eduardo Año wants local government units to pass uniform and harmonized ordinances that will be implemented against quarantine protocol violators nationwide amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Pinoys’ trust in US, Australia, China drops — SWS
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Filipinos’ trust in the United States, Australia and China dropped in the first half of the year, according to the latest survey by the Social Weather Stations.

item.title: Robredo: Focus on pandemic, not Charter change
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Vice President Leni Robredo yesterday called on government officials to make measures to stop the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 in the country their priority and not Charter change.

item.title: Recto pushes for hike of other health workers’ minimum pay
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Senate President Pro Tempore Ralph Recto yesterday pushed for hikes in the minimum pay of other health workers like medical technologists, dietitians and radiologists to the same level as that of nurses.

item.title: PCOO seeks inclusion of FOI bill in urgent measures
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Presidential Communications Operations Office wants the Freedom of Information bill included in President Duterte’s list of urgent measures this year.

item.title: Mass testing pushed to revive Philippine economy
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Allies of President Duterte in the House of Representatives have called on Health Secretary Francisco Duque III to launch mass testing for coronavirus disease 2019 to resuscitate the country’s battered economy.

item.title: Coconut oil credited for making provincial jail COVID-free
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Virgin coconut oil or VCO is being credited for making the Cebu Provincial Detention and Rehabilitation Center free of coronavirus disease 2019 as the city battled the COVID-19 pandemic in April and May.

item.title: 69,000 contact tracers deployed
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The country’s contact tracing capability is now at 98 percent, with over 69,000 contact tracers deployed nationwide amid the spike in the number of coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 cases, the Department of the Interior and Local Government reported yesterday.
